review: Just got off my bartending shift to grab a quick meal and beer at Fridays. Ordered a small beer but they served me a large...ok I can let that slide... Ordered the never ending shrimp deal to get charged for the refills which should be comp'd...ok I'll let it slide. The bartenders busy talking to other off work server regulars. But one thing I always notice...even tho the managers always tell the employees to smile they themselves look like they're so depressed they want to take their own life. Smile!! Not professional! I'll go back to my regular bar. Id give two stars but they probably won't read this review about the managers unless I put one.

AMAZING Happy Hour.   I was very satisfied with the food and service at this TGI Fridays.  It was nice to go to such a busy restaurant on a Friday afternoon and get great service.  I ordered the fish sandwich (there is only one on the menu) and a beer. The beers on tap during happy hour are about $3 each and well worth it. I also ordered the basket of fries which are very cheap.   They have lots of happy hour items, but none of them are seafood! I wish TGIF had more options for Pescatarians. However, it's still delicious fare. This location has a great ambiance and fun decor. It is a lot newer than some TGIF locations.

We go to this place often, Sundays for the most part because that's when they have their happy hour.  The service is great for the most part.  Albert takes care of everyone at the bar.  There has only been one time the waitress wasn't coming back to see how we were doing and it so happened to be one of the only times we actually needed someone.  I'm not a big fan of their food other than their appetizers and beer.  There is always parking and we've never had any issues finding a place at the bar.  Very good experiece overall

Have been here twice within the last 6 weeks and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Had no problem meeting our specials requests for my toddlers meals. The food was great and the prices were reasonable. Their stripes card saves us a lot of money and even found a $10 coupon on a package of their chips at the grocery store. Definitely will be back again.

Looks much better on the outside. When we went on a Wednesday night, like 7pm there was a waiting list. We put our name down, even though it seemed like there were at least 20 tables open.. When we got seated after ~8 minutes at a booth, our server got us drinks. I don't like the booth seats because the other diners are so close to us, so there is no privacy and we can literally hear everything they're saying.  After ordering, the food probably took about 10-15 minutes. We ordered: french onion soup fries 2 parmesan chicken  dragon fire salmon My friend got the french onion soup, it looked delicious, but she said it was way too salty. So she didn't finish that. Our chicken parmesan was good. I enjoyed it. It was breaded chicken breast on a bed of cheese tortellini with creamed spinach, side of cherry tomato caprese with mozarella cheese.  As for the dragon fire salmon, the fish itself was tasty. However, the rice came with canned mandarin oranges and weird toppings, and a hugeee side of broccoli. The fish could have been bigger. And I don't know about you, but putting rice with citrus fruit and peppers does not make it taste good, or does it make it an asian dish.  We had to flag down our server for checks and other requests. I don't think I'll be coming back here.

I came here late on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded.  The bar was a bit boisterous, but my group was seated in a nice area to the side that was actually quiet. Our waiter was helpful and we had a very productive evening.  The women's restroom was very tidy. There is a smoking area outside as well as outdoor/patio seating.  I've been to TGI Friday's in other cities and it was always ridiculously crowded and loud. This one definitely deserves a return trip.

I like this location particularly because there is never a wait, we always get a table right away. The food is always tasty, never had a bad meal here. Favs would have to be the Peanut Butter Pie, the battered shrimp with that Jack Daniels sauce and the Korean Steak Tacos. Overall drinks are pretty good and the service is attentive.

I FEEL LIKE A FREAKING LOSER EVERY TIME I WALK IN. Like that awkward kid that just sits there and eats his buggers. Cause everytime I go, I have to find my own waiter. Like wtf. What kind of establishment is this??? Find your own waiter?? Am I a fucking peasant or something??!!?? I refuse to stoop down and find my own waiter. I demand a red carpet, a cold beverage, and a moist towellete awaiting me upon my arrival. So unfuck yourselves tgif!!!!! But the food is delish:) thanks gems

My favorite TGIFs!  - Love the happy hour - Bartenders and waitresses and waiters are attentive  - Manager is understanding if you have a problem - Usually seating.  - Crazy karaoke nights  - NOT A TGIFs where its rowdy and wild. cool :) Want to ALWAYS get FREE food? - Go on a Happy Hour and buy something - Get the receipt and fill out their survey to get a free appetizer - Survey will give you appetizer for up to $8. Just use it on Happy hour - Next time you visit, just get one appetizer. They'll give you the receipt with the same survey!  - The cycle goes on forever! LOL. unless you don't come in 30days, then it expires. Stripes Rewards - Pick 2 for $10: certain Entree and Appetizer - 50 bonus stripes if you do certain surveys -25% off entire table purchase - Free entree with purchase of reg entree and 2 drinks - Free dessert on your birthday with purchase of any entree

I would not return to this TGI...our server took her time with everything!! I came with a group of 6 and she kept dropping off some of our waters/food and then having to go back for the others.  One person in our party placed an order early and it came out the same time as everyone else food...at least that one was compted...but everything else took a long time...she also never bothered to check on us

Nothing really special here the service is good, tends to take a little while when they are busy.  If you sign up for the email club you get coupons every couple of weeks, the bar has many different tvs, and the happy hour is always good.

I came here with my wife and three kids after our usual Saturday Target outing and was expecting a long lunch wait but got right in. Our waiter was really good  and fast. We told him up front that the kids were restless and he put the orders in right away. I had the french onion soup, caesar's salad and salmon...all were outstanding.  We were served quickly and everyone's meals all were great. The menu continues to change and upgrade which keeps us coming back to TGI F but this location in particular was really good. . I will definitely come back again to this location. Everyone I came in contact with was friendly and attentive.

NEVER.COMING.BACK. What manager decides to let one waitress handle 10 tables and the bar by herself?! I came with my co-workers on Veteran's Day as many of them are veterans and were looking to redeem a free lunch. Not worth it at all. It took about 45 minutes for the food to come out and another 45 minutes to get our bill because this one waitress was so busy trying to get so many different orders and requests. Poor girl but while it wasn't her fault, I still cannot and did not give any tip. Idiot manager. I guess onto the food if after reading this review, you still want to try TGI Fridays out in Brea. I got the Grilled Chicken Cobb Salad for $5.99 and it was freaking tiny. Decent in taste but not worth it on their "lunch special". A couple of my co-workers did think that the Jack Daniel Burger was pretty good if that is any consolation. I don't want to write anymore about this place. It sucks. Period.
It's pretty expensive for what you'll be getting. This place is big and gets loud at night. Food is okay not great. Okay service too.

They have an amazing happy hour! The DJ is awesome, he plays all the greatest hits from the today to back in the day. The drinks are reasonably priced and the bartender has a lot of energy. It is not rowdy and not to packed. Fun place to hang out with friends.

Came here with my buddy to watch the Lakers game only because BJ's and Yardhouse were completely packed. I had bad experiences with TGI Fridays in the past so I hadn't been to one in 10 years. I ordered the skillet garlic shrimp, which is a 'new' item on their menu consisting of shrimp, garlic, tomatoes and basil with rice and alfredo sauce served on a sizzling plate. The dish tasted fine but was excessively oily and the portion size certainly wasn't generous considering it costs $14. The servers are a mostly outgoing bunch, and I do appreciate that they didn't pester us after we had finished our food and were just finishing watching the game.

HAPPY HOUR FTW! I love to come here for happy hour and some drinks with friends to start off the weekend. If you plan to sit in their bar area then you most likely won't be able to hear eachother because they got the music bumping pretty loud in that section, but all the music that the DJ plays will get you in the mood for some dancing. The bartenders do cool tricks from time to time and they are generous with the amount of alcohol that they mix in their drinks. MANGO BERRY MARGARITA FROZEN is awesome! So tasty and one of my absolute favorites! but their classic favorite is the STRAWBERRY margarita! Happy hour is ALL DAY on sundays! and every afternoon from 3-6pm and every night from 10pm till closing which is about 2am!  GET THE: - Sliders - Captain Morgan Chicken Wings - Spinach & Artichoke Dip - Florentine Flat bread - Green Bean Fries - Red Velvet Cake - Strawberry Shortcake - Hot Fudge Sundae - Oreo Madness Don't forget about their 2 for $20 deal! take advantage of it because you get 1 appetizer to share, 2 entrees and a dessert to share! So bomb! Love coming here for happy hour because its cheap and you get a lot for what you pay for!
Service was kind of slow even though it was 4:30 p.m. when we came to dinner, on a Saturday. Otherwise, the experience was alright.

Great happy hour deal for drinks and appetizers, waitress was super enthusiastic and knowledgeable..  helped my lovably and completely indecisive friend pick out something awesome to wind the day down with. It's TGIF so it's pretty pedestrian decor and selection wise but what the heck.. we will definitely be back.
NEVER AGAIN. waitress was not attentive.  manager was prissy with the complaint.

Their alcohol selection isn't the greatest -- the margarita / martini cocktails that I ordered was not a flawless blend, as I had hoped it would be. But their appetizers and samplers are really tasty.

We've come here a couple of times for lunch, and both times had the same issue - really slow service after we were seated.  The first time was in the dining area, and this most recent one was at the bar.  I would've thought that we'd at least get an order for drinks within the first minute or so after we got our seats, but no... However, once we were checked on eventually and got our drinks and orders, it went smoothly.  Our orders were on point - I had the 2 for $10 combo of a Jack Daniel's Burger with a side of White Cheddar Queso, and Kathy ordered a Chicken Caesar Salad (and she ended up dipping her chicken into the side of Jack Daniel's glaze that came with my burger). Not that bad of an experience here - it's something to consider next time we're in the Brea area.

I tipped the host for seating us, taking our drink order, bringing us our drinks, and taking our food order. Someone else ran the food but we never saw our server until she brought us an empty plate and the check. Which we had to get up and find her to pay. Don't sit on the patio. It's the forgotten land.
Great for happy hour, love the appetizers at 1/2 price.

I come in about once a week. I love to sit in the bar area, alone or not. I get the excellent service from the bartenders. They are very friendly and always making sure I'm doing good. The food is wonderful. Since I fast every month - no meat or seafood, I come in and request for entrees not found on the menu. They are very accommodating. Tuesday nights are karaoke night, I just found out about that. Wednesday nights, there's a DJ.

Nice sized bar, decent setup. Friendly and fast service at the bar!  Happy hour from 3-7PM, not inconveniently  ending at 6PM like all the other places in Brea! +1 The appetizers are all half off for the most part, and the drinks specials were average priced for a happy hour. They don't cheap out on you on the pours though like how they do at Buffalo Wild Wings. Food selections were pretty tasty, although I will say the hibachi skewers were disappointingly small. Will likely come back again for draaaaaaaaaaaanks

Great customer service. I come here with my coworkers after work for some happy hour drinks and food.  This one dude at the bar always does tricks and makes the drinks stiff.  Clean area, friendly staff, and always well cooked food.  Why only three stars??

Tried to have lunch here but would not serve us on patio and then was told the only place we could sit was at the bar. I was game day and very loud!! Not what we were there for. The hostess was young and prissy rude and they lost my business.
Great service Medium wait on a Friday night Bomb Jack Daniels Ribs and Shrimp

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday with the girls around 930. There was barely one in there until about 1030 more people started coming in and they had a little karaoke night. We sat in the bar area which has happy hour until 10 so we all ordered $5 margaritas which were huge and tasted really good. I ordered a 6oz sirloin steak medium rare with mashed potatoes and substituted my second side for a bowl of clam chowder. My steak was cooked perfectly to a medium rare and was soo tender! Mashed potatoes were bomb! The clam chowder was brown for some reason and tasted a little spicy? I don't know, it tasted weird. Ill definitely be back for the steak and $5 margaritas again! And karaoke was fun and surprisingly entertaining.
Food was good and tasty. Not presented as nice as menu picture but that is to be expected.  We tried the lobster and salmon. Good taste even though they are not a seafood restaurant.

Our very last visit ever. The service was substandard, drink orders wrong, incomplete, couldn't get refills right. The food service was slow (restaurant was not crowded) & the food came out both cold and undercooked. The management didn't handle the problems well, and should have done more to make things right. worst $60 spent and a real damper on our Father's Day celebration. Prices have gone up, quality has plummeted.

I dont know why this place has so many bad reviews. Our service was great! The food was outstanding. The steak was the best I had all year. It was the top sirloin cooked medium rare. Nachos weren't bad either. The appetizers were half price during happy hour 3-6. Great food great service. Will come again!! Alan was our server and was very attentive.

Steak and ribs were better than I thought. I looooove their sauce! Its great! Some of the appetizers are small and overpriced but food quality is good! Service was friendly. I'd want to come here again.

I haven't been here since the remodel, I like it! I met some friends for lunch and we sat on the patio, we were the only ones out there. The day was perfect for outdoor dining, warm but not too warm. Our server was a little bland, I felt bad for her. It seemed like she was having an off day. She wasn't unpleasant or rude, just seemed a little off. She did have a glowing recommendation for the parmesan potato wedges that came with my burger and she was absolutely right, they were incredible. I got the steakhouse burger (at least I think that was the name). The burger was delicious. Cooked perfectly, it was topped with arugula, tomato, a spicy mustard sauce, and cheese. No need to add ketchup here, this bad boy is perfect as is. The burgers are now served on cutting boards with the fries in a parchment packet. I like this change. Drinks were always filled and our server checked on us regularly. Overall, I like Friday's and can't see why I wouldn't come back to this location if I was in the area.

My wife and I come here for lunch twice a month. We have never had a bad experience. Every employee we've interacted with has shown great customer service. Their food is delicious and our drinks are refilled immediately. I rather spend my hard earned money here than a fancy restaurant that provides poor customer service.

The $1.50 sliders for happy hour kind of remind me of Castle burgers..... But better and sweeter due to the caramelized onions. Hehe, i happen to like castle burgers, mom's side of the family is from the east side. The employees are always friendly, but for happy hour I'd would go to a place with a wider selection of drinks. As a suggestion, I think Lawry's sasoning daily would be awesome on their fries!!!! Yum!!!

We had dinner here on a Sunday night.   We were greeted by a friendly hostess.  She took us to our booth.  The booth failed my wife's "booth cleanliness test".  There were crumbs of some sort all over the seats.  Somehow, whomever was responsible for cleaning up, missed.  The waiter came to our table pretty quickly.  We ordered a Fish and chip for my wife, a macaroni n cheese and a Sprite that was part of the child's menu for the daughter, and I ordered the Flat Iron Steak.  Before ordering, I gave him a coupon for 20% off our bill.   The waiter quickly brought out 3 cups of water for us.  But, it seemed like he forgot about the Sprite that the daughter ordered.  It took him almost the full 20 minute episode of My Little Pony that my daughter was watching on the IPad.   After bringing out the Sprite, he brought out the food for us.  My wife asked for some tartar sauce for her fish and chips, but, again, it seemed like he had forgotten.  She had almost finished one of 3 pieces of fish before he brought it out.  None of the other foods that we ordered needed any condiments.  The Flat Iron steak was seasoned well.   I had to order medium rare because the wife wanted to try it.  Unfortunately, like most places, they overcooked it.   I should have ordered it rare to get it medium rare. The child's Mac n cheese stood no chance as it was half a box of cheap Kraft Macaroni and Cheese   Please don't feed her the real stuff with real cheese.   Only the powdered Mac n cheese for her.      It took awhile before the waiter figured out that we were finished.  It would have been nice if we wanted to sit and relax, but, we needed to go home.  The waiter presented me with the bill.  I was ready to give him my credit card when I reviewed it, and noticed that he forgot about the 20% off coupon that I gave him at the time of ordering.  He came back 5 minutes later to give a revised bill.  With the waiter's track record of disappearing,  I wanted to pay the bill so that we could get out of there.   But, after his mistake, I wanted to take a look at it.  So, he left again and didn't come back for another five minutes.  We finally paid and were able to get out of there.   Overall, it was a "Meh" experience.  The food was okay, not great, or inedible.  The waiter was not good.  I wouldn't want to come back here.  Too many other places  that I can go to for about the same price or less.

We came here a couple weeks ago and it was actually very good.  They have completely remodeled the inside, which is fine, although I'm a bit nostalgic for the old layout.  I got the jack Daniels chicken which was enough to share with another person and it was cooked perfectly.  Our waiter was a chill skater type guy and he was really nice and brought us everything quickly.  All in all, a decent place to go.

I've been here several times after work with my gf during their happy hour specials.  This rating is specifically for the happy hour experience only, not the regular dining experience which would have a different ratting.  I give this place a 3.49 stars. We've always ordered from their 1/2 off appetizers only.  It's worth the money an highly recommend if you choose not to cook at home, stay within a reasonable budget for restaurant visit, yet have some tasty foods. The customer service is okay, but it gets better when the waiter knows you need a drink refill! The food quality here is reasonable, but for what you pay for i cant complain. i can complain about their strawberry shortcake though... Feedback is that it was mostly vanilla ice cream and not very much shortcake--they need to call it a vanilla ice scream scoops with a tiny slice of scake.  i wont order it again.  But i will keep coming here for their overall atmosphere, low happy hour prices, and location.

I love this place and the food... but lately I have been disappointed.  2 times in the last couple months I have gone there and they have been out of Bud Light or their Draft beer was broken.... This is not cool. Also, if you order your food from the bar... be ready to send it back. They mess up your order 90% of the time.

Horrible for lunch.. Dont go ...let me rephrase that dont go..6.99 all you can eat soup and salad ...good price RIGHT? well the price matches the food..dont waste your seven bucks...the clam chowder is not clam chowder not even canned clam chowder..it is some mystery chowder they came up with. i WAS WONDERING WHY THERE WAS ONLY ONE other couple eating lunch when we went around noon and now i know why..the service was good but that was all . YOU WILL BE AMAZED AT HOW BAD ALL OF THE SOUPS ARE.. i TRIED ALL OF THEM and was very hungry when we went...Wont be back .,EVER!...BREA  FRIDAYS
The spinach flatbread appetizer was amazing!! John was our server & he was attentive and made our night extra special!!

Came to celebrate my sisters birthday at this location a few weeks ago on a Sunday night.  Let me just start off by saying that our waiter was GREAT. He immediately greeted us and he checked on our table more times than a lot of other waiters do. I don't remember his name but he had really long hair... Also, at one point during our meal the manager of this location stopped by our table, talked to my family for a little bit and even got my sister a refill on on of her drinks, now that's being a team player. Now for the food, we ordered several appetizers, the potato skins which are always good here, and the spinach dip which was surprisingly fantastic. For my entree, I ordered a Jack Daniels Burger which is basically a cheeseburger with bacon and a cup of sauce. It was excellent and the rest of my family also enjoyed their meals.  Overall, I will keep on coming back to this restaurant because the service and food is great.

The only reason I gave them one star is there is no option for negative stars.  Filet was un edible, notified server immediately and switched to a burger- which still was not out 5 min after everyone else finished.  My ribeye tasted ok (but not for $20), very small, mashed potatoes tasted like bad instant.  Service was friendly

So its was super bowl Sunday and me and my bf were hungry and we decided to eat at tgif since buffalo wild wings said it was at full capacity and wasn't letting anybody in at the moment. We ordered some boneless wings and we got half of them with garlic parmesan and regular buffalo sauce they were tasty and crunchy so no complaints there. For entree I got the sizzling chicken and shrimp and my bf got the Philly steak burger. My plate was good but the burger was CRAP, first of all the picture on the menu shows a large burger with French fries making u think you think it will satisfy your appetite ,WRONG! the burger was really small and completley deceiving in size and came in with 15 skinny small French fries in a small brown bag. A big mac from McDonalds is larger than the Philly cheese steak burger my bf ordered , so I recommend no getting a burger its a waste of ur money for what u get.

I'm going to say this is worst TGI Friday's I have ever been to, I was here on Monday Feb 3rd, my friend and I was waiting for awhile to have server arrange seats for us, we told them we would like to have a booth but I wasn't sure what happen to them still arrange seats on table.  we were very hungry so we decide just sit down and order food asap if possible.  the nightmare has not stop yet, we have been waited for another 15 minutes to order our food and drinks ( the restaurant was pretty empty, probably only 8 tables in whole restaurant)  well, after food arrived, we had good time for about 1 hour to enjoy our food, then don't know why the fire alarm was ringing out loud like crazy for no reason. every customer can not stand the sounds so most of customers ran outside.  I will never come back to this place again :(

Been to this location a few times, had good and bad experiences, but I'll just talk about last night.  We went specifically to watch the UFC fight and  told the hostess this upon arriving. We waited 40 minutes for a table, which is expected on a Saturday night, and got a table underneath a tv with the next nearest one about 25' away. Wow, really? How are we supposed to watch it? We literally saw about 10 empty tables in the same area and asked if we can sit at a particular one instead so we can actually see the damn fight and the hostess said she would have to ask if that was okay. She comes back and says that we have to wait another 25 minutes to sit at one of those empty tables. I immediately ask for a manager and she says okay fine, go ahead and sit there then. Confusing ass bitch. We sat down and noticed there was no sound...sucks. We were able to "watch" the fight but not like we wanted. Now I know why they don't charge to come in and watch it. And now I know to never go back there again for a UFC night. Besides that annoying shit we dealt with, our waitress was super sweet and did a great job. I ordered a burger and I inhaled that shit. Super yummy! Only bad thing about the food was the small dinner salad that I ordered...it says it comes with shredded cheese and that's what literally was on it...one piece of shredded cheese. Meh.
We went there and were seated, then sat there for 15 minutes and were totally ignored.  I would have given 0 stars if I could.

Terrible customer service.  Called to find out how long a wait for a party of 6 would be on a Saturday night at 7:30.  Was told by the hostess, that she just sat all the party tables and it was up to how long the diners wanted to eat.  Very rude and not at all willing to say come on in and we'll find a table for you.  Just matter of fact, I don't know.  Won't be dining here again, who knows how long a wait will be.
My parmesean chicken, and my husband's ribeye were both so dry they were pretty much inedible. Service was slow. At least the drinks were good.

i rarely come here, only when i'm desperate for happy hour. If i need a drink and yardhouse, chacha's, kabuki dont have hh going on, then tgif becomes the only option. Came here on a thursday night the service was overall TERRIBLE. i think there was literally 1 server for the entire bar area. I get, i was a server myself, it can get overwhelming. but when youre staying at a table longer and flirting with a bunch of frat dudes makes it inexcusable. took forever for our orders to get out, ask for the check, wait for them to get the check, ETC. and the music, oh my lorddd. i'm sorry but blasting music and letting drunk college kids do karaoke isn't going to make this place more hip. Lastly, the food sucks. The end.

I don't think I have EVER been to a good TGIF. I have never returned my food, ever, until this night. My soup was freezing cold and I asked our server to warm it more. She replied "oh you like it hot?" Uhhh yes? Thats why I ordered soup? That is usually how it is served! She brings me back my soup and it is still cold.... So I gave that up. My boyfriends burger was way too pink and the fries were cold. The only positive experience was she kept my drinks coming.  The table behind us was empty and completely covered with leftover food and dishes the entire time we were there. No wonder there were flies. Just nasty...

This TGI Fridays is the most pathetic restaurant I have ever been to.  My party arrives and we give our name in for a table. They said it would be around 15 minutes because the place was full, and being a Saturday evening, I figured that was understandable. About 20 minutes later they called my party back. Walking to the seating area of the restaurant, I realized 60% of the tables were empty, and a dozen employees were just hanging around. That didn't stack up right in my head. Our waiter was decent with keeping up on drinks and checking up on us initially. We all had ordered burgers/sandwiches that come with fries. As seen in the picture I put up, there were very few fries. I don't see why a waiter would even bring a plate like that out. He then seemed startled when we expressed our lack of appreciation for the insufficient amount of fries (considering their prices, they could at least prepare the plates to look as they do in the pictures). He responded with a slightly sarcastic attitude, and went back to get a small plate of another serving of fries. After that he didn't seem to care much for our table anymore. He dropped the check off and that was it. The place is pretty clean, and of course in a nice area. The food was over-all good, but the service by the uneducated employees (at least the ones you deal with) make it a terrible restaurant to eat at. I will probably never got back to this location again.

I think my nostalgic longing for this place (from the days of being in high school) skew my decision to go here. My memory tells me it's going to be good and I crave it. We get there and it never hits the mark.  The wait is usually long, the servers are under trained and the food is lacking.   The portions have shrunk and the quality has decreased. I keep trying different things and can't find anything that I want a second time.   They don't really have fair prices either.   The kid meal options are weak. My boys usually end up splitting an adult meal.
Can never go wrong with TGI Friday's Shrimp! The service was ok, but hey, 2 for twenty special works for me.

I have gone two times recently, and had a great experience both times. First time: Excellent customer service from our service. She gave us sincere recommendations and was friendly. Crisp apple sangria is tasty and the steak is delicious and came out perfectly cooked. Second time: More excellent customer service from our waiter! I think he was new because he seemed nervous and excited to be helping us (customer service veterans should understand), but he did a great job, despite me being slightly tipsy at some point and asking him to find out what kind of leaf they used to garnish the boyfriend's drink. (It was a pineapple leaf. How cool! No regrets, haha). Food: Both times I had no complaints, but I only remember specifics on the most recent occasion. I can recommend the Sizzling Steak & Spinach and the Pineapple Sangria (possibly called something else). I believe it had some coconut rum in it. So tasty. Dangerously tasty. Boyfriend also got steak and was very happy with it as well. We weren't a fan of the Parmesan fries, they were more like potato wedges and I didn't taste any seasoning or cheese. The mashed potatoes would have been a better choice, but I guess that's what I get for letting him choose his own meals. ;) The big complaint: There is NEVER a host/hostess at the front! Why do you even have a podium there if you're not going to use it? Both times I waited 5+ minutes to be greeted and sat, and it was completely empty - no people waiting. The second time I was tempted to call them just to get their attention (the phone is by the hostess's podium, of course). Also the decor is really tacky, and would benefit from a lot of the random stuff on the walls being taken down. But I guess now we're just splitting hairs.

Love how late they're open and the Happy Hour deals are unbeatable.  Bartenders are always down to earth and efficient.  The food is good for being open until 1am and priced usually under five bucks.  Love coming to Friday's.

Originally I am from Connecticut, grew up eating at Fridays and always had great service and food. This was the first time I came to a Fridays in California, and probably the last. I have never written a review about anywhere, but I felt the need too because of this  The service was awful. I think our waitress has potential but needs a hell of a lot more training. When I first got there and she took down our drinks I asked for just a house salad with honey mustard dressing on the side. I noticed 2 other tables filled up with people while waiting for my salad and actually had gotten appetizers before I even got my salad, felt like we were invisible because she barely came and checked if we needed anything and didn't even ask if we wanted appetizers. So when I asked her about my salad, instead of admitting she forgot about it, she said let me check on that, 2 minutes later came out with a quickly thrown together salad with ranch dressing on the side instead of honey mustard like I asked. I got my salad and right after another girl brought out our entrees, which kind of bothered me. My girlfriend ordered the Grilled Salmon with Langostino dish said that the fish wasn't all that great, the rice was clumpy, but the mashed potatoes were pretty good. I got some grilled chicken dish but it wasn't anything special.  The happy hour drink specials are great and definitely worth it, but my girlfriend tried ordering a Jackberry Smash because she saw it on the website. When she brought it up she said she never heard of it and said even the bar tender never heard of it. There is something similar in the drink book but I just find it odd they promote a drink on their website but never heard of it.

Worst food and service. Don't waste your money.  All employees were either on their phone or hanging out talking. Our food looked like it was cooked all the way and we waited about an hour just receive our food while everyone around us was that got there after us were getting their food. After they brought us the food, not all of it was ready. The server said she will bring it out as soon as it's done. I couldn't believe it! There's a reason why they have such low reviews on here! I wonder why management hasn't made a change...I still and will never return.

Went to Friday's because it was close by and I had a small window to grab something to eat.  I normally don't go to chains, but I have to say I really enjoyed my meal.  We decided to go with some appetizers to share.  The potstickers were surprisingly good, as were the bacon and cheese bites.  The Sesame Jack Chicken Strips were good as well.  I know I'll be going back.  I see they're open after 10:00 pm, so I'll be able to stop in for a bite after work.

"Why don't we ever go to the TGIF's in Brea?" I asked my wife, "It's a lot closer than the others..." We agree that we can't remember why we easily drive double (may 3x) the distance to Yorba Linda and give this another try for a late-night dinner (many times, 9-11pm ish). Having to wait to be seated isn't too much an issue, I mean, this is a fairly busy place. My issue, which I was reminded of once seated, became apparent and immediately jogged our memory. Issue 1: hostess and host (I am guessing) goofing off like they're on a date. I'm all for having fun at work - especially on the late shift - this isn't the time or place for a date. Issue 2: once sat, none of the servers acknowledged us - we got more "looks" from the tables sat after us when it was obvious they "jumped us" in line. This not only happened with their drink order, it continued after they were served drinks AND appetizers. We're out at this point - it was easily approaching the half hour mark. Issue 3: this isn't the first time it's happened - we've been to this location 6-8 times and, to bring it back to why we drive to other locations, it's because of the horrible service. It's been so long since actually eating there, I have to only assume the food is ok. Goodbye for good, TGIF of Brea!
The service is good but the food prep is on par with Denny's. Chicken was super dry and mashed potatoes taste like they were instant. Fridays used to be better. Food seemed better before the remodel.

Food is decent. Review is about the service. I don't know if it's the managers or the owner wanting to be cheap by not hiring the proper staff but every time we go in it's like one waitress to the entire bar area. When the waitress doesn't come by to refill your drink for 15 minutes or ask if you need anything- not ok

It was Friday...so where else should we go? Drinks? Ok fine...I had my Give Me More Stripes program that is why we went...FREE FOOD! Yes, I ordered the Jack Daniel's flat iron steak with mashed potatoes and macaroni and chesse. Also, loaded potatoes as an appetizer and a Jack Daniel's petite steak with parmesan steak fries and ginger coleslaw. Let me just say that their Jack Daniel's sauce is the best! Caramelized onions and that sweet and spicy taste that is sure to make the mouth water. I ordered rare and my husband a medium rare. Both were actually cooked correctly! What?! That is just too awesome. The mashed potatoes is nice and smooth with a hint of cheese (for those who don't like green onions, let the server know). I would suggest to dip it in the sauce as well, but eating it by itself already has enough flavor. The macaroni and cheese wasn't my favorite like Alondra Hot Wings in Alhambra. This had too much oil and the cheese was not a good choice as well. Try not to order this side... Parmesan steak fries was horrible. Salty, buttery, and soggy. Stick with the regular or sweet potato fries. The ginger coleslaw...if you like ginger, then you will enjoy this dish...on the other hand...myself...was an acquired taste.  Lastly, the service here was excellent. They were very attentive and always made sure that we were doing well. Thank you to Maria and Tyler!  *Karaoke night is Tuesday, so come sing your heart out!  *Must try the beach bum for a limited time, $5 each.

The hostess (a young hispanic girl working on thursday at 845) was too busy chatting away to greet us much less take u to our table. We waited for a long time, though it was not a busy night. We even resorted to asking the bartender to seat us instead because we were tired of waiting for her. Finally when she came we were seated and had a great waitress after dealing with the awful hostess.

Had to get couple shots of tequila and  a dos equis. Since it was on a deal. But the service was super slow, specially since it was slow,  bruschetta as an appetizer is too little. Just so u know wat to expect.

If there was a way to give no stars I would. I have been to Tgif 2 times since they reopened both times the staff could give a crap about serving me or getting my order right.  During my first experience I was sitting at the bar eating after waiting for 20 mins for someone to even notice that I needed another beer or was even alive (because all 3 of the bartenders where spinning bottles in the air like some lame Tom Cruise movie) once they stopped spinning bottles for 2 sec I got their attention and then the bartender didn't ask if I wanted a refill they just put the check in a glass and didn't even say thanks or anything and went back to spinning the bottles again. I am never going to this TGif again.  Their lame!

The food is as expected. A little disappointed because I ordered a "tropical umbrella drink" and didn't get an umbrella.  We had to wait almost 20 minutes after out appetizer came to even order our entrees. Service sucks.

Haven't had bad service to deserve 1 star but tonight is the night. Well last trip we had terrible (in the Charles Barkley voice) service but hey maybe sitting in the restaurant instead is better. It was empty but still got slow service. Well wedge salad is good and my wife like her petite steak but the sizzling chicken and cheese was disgusting as HELL. Chicken had no flavor and the cheese basically burns to the bottom of the sizzling iron skillet. I figures the cheese came on the chicken but it doesn't it basically is on the green peppers and onions but ends up burning onto the skillet. Not sure what chef came up with idea but is sucks.  Then it gets worse I had to wait 15 minutes to get my check! Seriously 15 minutes when it's almost empty wow. Then I get the bill and notice they LIE yes LIE to make you tip larger! Do the math yourself people because this business (maybe company) is shady as hell! So my bill was $21.60 and they do the suggested tip base on percent well 15% suggested was $3.96 according to Fridays math but regular math is $3.24. So 20% suggested was $5.28 but real math is $4.32 wow almost a dollar more. Waitress was lucky I even gave a tip after they BS, needless to say Fridays is now on my blacklist along with Chick-Fil-A and I will never eat there again, not because the food and service sucked but they are trying to lie to the customer to get larger tips! BBB needs a call if you ask me! I will post pic so you don't think I'm making it up either
Love this place, the best happy hour plus it's everyday. The bartenders fun and nice. Food is good and there are lots of drink selections

I've been to this TGI Friday's and the one in Ontario. My experience at this location was lacking in a lot of departments, especially service. I forgot our server's name, but she made a bad first impression. She was taking the order of the party next to us before she came to ours. And apparently a person in that party was her friend because she was talking to her for a solid 10 minutes about Disneyland and school before she even took her order. It was annoying listening to her have small talk with her friend when our party was ready to order. Additionally, a member in our party ordered a burger that she wanted cooked medium, and when it came, the server said "here is your burger, WELL-DONE." The member of our group asked if the burger was well-done or medium, like she ordered it, and the server went back to the kitchen to ask. She came back and said it was like you ordered it, medium. It didn't look medium from where I was sitting but I will give our server the benefit of the doubt. The food was alright, it is what you would expect from a TGI Friday's at any location. But the thing that sets chain restaurants apart is the service that they provide, and this location unfortunately falls flat.
I didn't complain which is ok!!!the only thing tonight is the chicken of my Nacho is a little hard.

The food was decent but it took 40 mins just to get seated when the place appeared to be empty. Once seated took another 20 Mins just to take our order and 30 mins just for our food to come out. Staff appears just to be hanging around. Don't come here Unless you have the whole day to waste.
My sister and I went for Happy Hour and had a variety of appetizers. The ambiance was great, the service impeccable and the food was great. We are definitely going back.
Very disappointed, food was fair, service fair and it took over an hour to get our food. Won't be back.
The food was awful  Took my wife out for dinner  We ordered the food came and was horrible

We came here before going to a show during happy hour. My friend really likes coming to this place before and after shows for the happy hours. I didn't think the food or the drinks that tasted water down were that great. Our waiter was hard to find when we wanted something. I was told this is normal for a TGIF. I'm not against coming back.
Uhh the all you can eat appetizer sucks.... at least the boneless chicken does.  It's like orange chicken in Jack Daniel's or Buffalo flavors.  Terrible.  Mostly deep fried batter.

The service SUCKS! Excuse my language, but this is the first time I came to the TGIF in Brea, I came because of the good experience I had in long beach but I'll never be back to this one. The customer service was horrible. It's not even busy and the server did not check on us. The lady who brought out our food asked "is there anything I can get for you?" I asked for BBQ sauce and she looked at me as if she wasn't expecting me to ask her for anything. She walked away with an attitude and of course never brought it. Then our actual server comes and we ask him, twenty minutes and he still hasn't brought us our sauces. Something as simple as that should be assisted within 5-10 minutes. I can see if this place was busy but it's not at all.  No wonder why they have so many negative reviews. They need to hire better servers! This whole restaurant needs to be under new management.

Came here for HH and it was fairly busy, but the server still didn't come by to check on us that much.  Luckily, as a group we are fairly laid back, but it took time to replace the chips and and the food wasn't as fresh as other HH we have gone to.  Bottom line is there are other options for HH and for price and taste, our HH group has chosen elsewhere to go.
I don't know why everyone come to complain on here... TGIF brea is great. I always have a good time here.

Today was my birthday... So my husband ask me where I would like to go. I said, "I love TGIF". So we went to this one in brea. The receptionist said it would be a 15 min wait, so we waited at the bar assuming we would be called to our table when it was ready but after a while we were never called. Our name were scratched off the list, so my husband went to go talk to the receptionist to get us our seats. After he talked to her we were sat down and from there the waitress seemed very rude. My husband ask for the special for the appetizers and about a birthday dessert for me and she responded out of annoyance with us. Through out the entire dinner it was a long wait for the food drinks and service all around. Unfortunately I didn't not get to enjoy my birthday dinner due to some racism I did not speak of and lack of service, respect, acknowledgment the waitress did not give when my husband repeatedly ask for my "birthday embarrassment". I still love TGIF and the enviorment it portrays however I would never recommend this exact site because of the employees that treated us this disrespect.
Poor service. Got our order wrong. Not too  familiar with current deals and promotions. Jasmine rice was lumpy and hard. Loaded mash were hard. We dont plan on returning.

Location is great ! Very clean and we'll maintained. Service was ok not the best but he got the job done. I really like the outside it was really nice and the fire pits really adds a good touch. Sunday is all day happy hour which is awesome! I'm glad I didn't have to sit in the bar for happy hour prices. The bar is just a tad to loud for my taste. But will be going back I'm sure !

Met with 2 of my old Co workers here for lunch to catch up and have a good time. Food was good. Went during the endless appetizers promotion. But service was not all that great. Sat in the bar area, during a late lunch service, so restaurant was not busy at all. Most of everyone was still at work. She maybe had 3 or 4 couples sitting at the actual bar. We ordered a refill on our apps and never received them. Nor did she check to see if we received them until we had to get her attention just to bring us the check. She never really checked to see how our food was or to see if we where ok. She pretty much took our orders. Gave us 1 refill. And brought us our check after we had to go out of our way to get her attention. Overall it probably will be back just won't expect good service.

Food was absolutely horrendous! Especially for the price. The food was hard and tasted like a burnt asshole, the staff just as bad everyone standing behind the bar in a circle jerk talking to each other. Don't waste your time or money

After visiting during lunch hour I was very disappointed. Jill the bartender took our order and immediately gave us our bill. She was rude and never asked if we were okay/needed anything. Good was good just ask for another bartender! :)

I used to love TGIF back in my college days which were 8 years ago.  Haven't had the time to ever go back during happy hours for their appetizers.  This review is solely for the happy hour menu.  The sesame jack chicken strips didn't taste like before, they were smaller portions and more dry then last time when I first had it.  The tuscan spinach dip was okay, the potato wedges are totally different now.  They cut it into quarters instead of halves, they should have kept it like the old days.  The quesadillas were small and they are different.  I didn't know that all their famous appetizers changed.  O, how I miss the old TGIF days.  Cheers to old times.

Not the worst restaurant experience I've ever had- but definitely in the bottom 10. I have to start with thanking TGI Fridays - my wife and I left laughing because of how incredibly terrible our meal was. It was so bad that we just had to laugh.  I won't get into the whys on why we chose to go here on Friday night, but it had to do with nostalgia.   Anyways, we arrive here at 6:30 on a Friday night and have to wait about 5-10 minutes. Not that bad of a wait, but was a bit odd when I was taken back to my seat and realized more than half of the restaurant was empty.  That was the first warning sign. I've always enjoyed the turkey burger here and I ordered that and my wife ordered some flatbread pizza thing.  I was beyond disappointed to realize that they changed the turkey burger. It's not bad because they changed it, it's bad because what they changed it to something that was basically inedible.  The turkey patty is way too big, the texture is really off, and it tastes disgusting. It went from being one of my favorite things on the menu to something I will never ever order again.  After a few bites I just took the patty off and ate the rest of the sandwich without it.   My wife's flatbread pizza was basically a very large tough cracker with dried out cheese and toppings on it. I guess there was some barbecue sauce drizzled, but I got baked into the crust so it did nothing for the pizza.  I know it's flatbread, but it was the driest "pizza" I've ever tasted.  It tasted overcooked and old. The table itself was in bad shape, lots of wear and tear and the booth and the table seemed pretty sticky.  All the items on the table were pretty gross too- the ketchup  bottle and the little advertisement thing we're also really sticky and stained. Needless to say, I had to wash my hands a few times during this meal. The one positive I can say is that the employees were all friendly enough. They weren't the most efficient, but they weren't terrible either. I would say service was average and they were friendly.  But that's really it - that's the nicest thing I can say about this experience.  And friendly servers with average service is not enough to warrant another star. Like I said, as my wife and I were walking to the car I said to her, "Damn that was such a terrible meal!"  She laughed and agreed and we couldn't remember the last time we had such a bad outing at a restaurant.  So thanks TGI Friday's for that moment at least - I guess. Either way if you couldn't tell from the review, just don't do it. Just don't do it.

I came in on Saturday October 4th late night around 1230AM. I sat in the bar for happy hour! The server was very attentive and got us more drinks very frequently. I wish I remembered his name because he was awesome!! My friend and I shared nachos which were delicious and sliders and fries! Love this place and would definitely come back! The only thing I would comment on is that when we got in all the empty tables weren't cleaned and we had to call a bus boy to clean a table for us so we could sit. Other than that it is was great!

OMG! So, I ordered the Thai Pork Tacos and I was super hungry after leaving the gym and they were below my calorie count...AND...come to find out...for good reason! They were EXTREMELY SMALL!!!! About 3.5" in diameter!!! Are you kidding me?! With "tacos" this small, they really need to show a picture that is accurate OR put the size in the description. Not cool. I left hungry and irritated. They were, however, very tasty and not too spicy at all, but the size definitely matters here!

My husband has Celiac Disease.  We order a Gluten Free Cheeseburger that was on the menu.  We suspected the bun was not gulten free when we got it but tasted it to be sure.  We asked the waitress about it and the only response we got "Well I asked for gluten free!" Twice...  My husband was ill all afternoon so I made a complaint on the website indicating which restaurant we were at, what time, and the fact that there were on two other customers there.  This is the response I got: Hi Bonnie, Thank you for emailing TGI Fridays. Our kitchens are not set up to prepare items in order to keep complete separation of gluten-free items from those containing gluten. However we have a set of menu items that are carefully prepared for our guests with gluten sensitivities.  Although these items are gluten-sensitive, they may not be completely free of gluten. We have shared your comments with our research and development team, and we apologize that your husband was not feeling well.  Is he alright now, and would you like to receive a follow up call from management from the location that you visited?  If you would like to receive a follow up call, please respond with the location that you visited. Thank you for your interest in TGI Fridays! Sincerely, Kelsey M Guest Relations Support

Usually go here for a drink and appetizers, but decided to grab a burger earlier today. Eff that.  Their fries taste like the leftover fries you get from farmer boys that you heat up in the oven the next day.  And the burger, straight up the same as the 6 dollar burger from Carl's jr. No joke.

We came here with our two kids on a week night... Didn't think it would be too busy and it wasn't. The hostess was nice enough, but our server was just extremely awkward...acting like he was in a mad dash- it stressed you out just to be around him. Then we randomly had a different server after getting our drinks- and this new guy was very quite....like not cut out for being a personable server. The food took a long time but was decent when it arrived. However, $20 a plate for "ok" quality food is not something I'd come back for. It is very pricey for what you get... it's a chain, I get it, it is not gourmet handcrafted food, but overall still a little disappointing. :-/ I left feeling just Meh.

I don't know why we keep coming here. The last time we were here (two weeks ago) the food was OK, but our server, he was pretty much unattentive.  Tonight we came, were told that there was only one server so we had to wait about ten minutes to be seated.  It took another few minutes for our server to greet us and take our drink orders.  Tonight I unfortunately decided to try the firecracker chicken with rice and broccoli. We waited for another 20 min or so for our food, keep in mind the restaurant was not packed.  When the food arrived I immediately regretted what i ordered.  It looked like it was prepared in a microwave! Especially the broccoli. It was almost rubbery! As was the chicken breast. Must have went from freezer to microwave. Luckily I ordered extra sweet chili sauce to mask the weird taste of the chicken.  My hubby ordered the French dip which was just OK, Fridays is very cheap with their portions in regards to their fries!  I think the only thing that keeps this place going is their bar. The food is not worth returning for, but tonights service was OK.

Horrible service!! Came in one day for a drink and appetizers and we got a seat by the bar. The bartender immediately asked us to see our ID, but unfortunately my friend left hers at home. So the bartender was super mean and told us not only can she not order drinks, she can't even sit at the bar while I order a drink. Wtf?? So we were rather unhappy about the situation, so we decided to order take out instead so we can eat and drink back home. The bartender took our to go order and basically told us we couldn't wait at the bar and had to go sit in the front waiting area for our order. Wow! Wtf? It's not like we are drinking, just sitting and waiting. He did not smile at all the entire time we were there and just had a really bad attitude. NEVER coming here again!!! Beware of terrible service!

Horrible experience late Saturday night. The bar area was open so we take a seat. We were greeted by a nice man who took our appetizer order. Later, an Asian man with a shaved head comes up and asks what to drink. He begins screaming my order out loud across the bar to the tender! Every customer turned around ! Not only was he screaming our order across the bar, when I wanted to cash out, he would not return my change! I had to ask another employee 20 minutes after waiting. Should have called corporate what an unprofessional fool.

Came in for the All you could eat sampler one night. We found you could not mix the orders? You would think it was a simple request and a good way for TGIF to offer up it's Bill of fare. I just don't understand the logic. Spent many year merchandising and marketing.

Come here all time after work with my girlfriend and friends ! Every time we come Patrick is bar tending and is also so nice and attentive. Jay is here frequently and he is great as well.  I've seen the other bar tenders multiple times as well and they are all great ! It's a chill place to come and relax and watch football or just listen to music with some friends. Highly recommend to friends and anyone looking for a comfortable place to hangout and catch a few drinks.

Happy hr all day every Sunday's,  you can't go wrong with it.  I enjoy coming here for Sunday night football and some Lakers games. Staff are very friendly,  and during the nice hot summer,  the patio is a good spot to drink and chill to do people watching.

Ordered a slider meal with fries, Jack Daniels chicken, steak and ribs to go. Get home and nothing is Jack Daniels and they didn't give us the fries for the sliders. We call to ask for a new order, the manager Ashley was very nice about it and asked us to bring the food back and they would remake it. My husband went in at 1:20 to retrieve our new food and asked if we could get a milkshake to go, the bartender had a really poor attitude and was angry they had to make a drink 40 minutes before closing... Just got home and the food still didn't have Jack Daniels sauce on it and my steak was so overcooked I can't even cut it with the knife I was provided. We are staying in a hotel so I can't get a metal knife anywhere. It's now after closing and we are left with a mediocre meal. Really disappointing. Only Giving two stars because the manager tried to be helpful.

HORRIBLE SERVICE! My daughter LOVES TGI Friday's so wanted to come here after her final Nutcracker Performance. This is by far the worst Friday's location I have ever visited. We arrived at about 5:15pm on December 21st. It wasn't busy. We waited nearly 10 minutes to be greeted by our wait person. She took our order and it took over 15 minutes to get appetizers and 45 minutes for our food. When we were served our food, 2 of the dishes were wrong and partially cold. Then we had to ask for silverware. Asked several times for a water refill and a glass of water for my daughter. Got the refill but never got the other glass of water. Again, this place was NOT busy when we got there and our server was not the only server so I'm not sure what the problem was. We definitely made our feelings known to those waiting outside when we finally left this place. I will not be coming back to this Friday's, especially when I have had much better experiences at other locations. Awful, Awful, Awful.

NEVER IN MY LIFE.  Bartender was our waitress. Margie was her name on our check.  We had to ask for silverware and it was given to us with attitude.  We had to ask for her to refill our waters.  We had to ask her to place our orders, she was gone for long periods of time, multiple times.  We had to ask her for a kids menu and she gave attitude when I asked and made it known she didn't want to go out of her way to go get it.  It was NY day and we were in the bar area but it wasn't that busy, it was about 2:30 and maybe 10 people when we were there. (It was prior to happy hour.) This was not the first time, nor the second time, we have had shitty service at Brea and this is the reason we don't ever come here. The reason we came today was because we had received a gift card for Christmas. And we will never, ever be back after this episode.  THE KICKER: we waited for our last endless app to come out and our bill and it was taking a really long time (as usual.) I tracked down the bartender who was at the bar to please print our check and I went back to my table to get my credit card. While I was there, the GENERAL MANAGER (it said so on his shirt) came out to deliver our final appetizer. We asked him if we could have the food to go because we had waited so long and he told us no, the endless apps weren't allowed to go. We told him about how crappy the service was, about the 40 mins between "endless apps" and he just walks away! He didn't apologize, nothing! He told us again the apps can't be taken to go and He just walked away! Absolutely the worst customer service I have EVER experienced in my life.  We have a 17 month old, we work full time jobs with opposite schedules, we rarely see each other. it is a RARITY, a luxury, for my husband and I to go out to have lunch. We are paying for a service and an experience. We would like to have lunch with a few basic services, and management who doesn't completely ignore us and basically tell us to eff off.  What we should have done was not paid the bill and straight walked out on our tab. You want to be jerks, than I can be one right back. You all should be ashamed.  I will never step foot in your establishment again, you couldn't pay me. You should be embarrassed, TGIFridays. You need to reevaluate and retrain your staff and management. What a shame.

I have been here a few times this last year and My experience so far has been great. Although, I recently went with a large party of 10 last Sunday and the service wasn't the best. I was greeted by the hostesses (who are always nice), but my waiter was forgetful and seemed on edge. The odd thing was, that the restaurant didn't even seem to busy. It took forever for our appetizers to arrive and when they did they were not correct and the waiter said he "did not know that we still wanted that" (an order we placed with him earlier on.

Usually pretty happy with this chain.  Came in a bit later around 9.30 and service was very sterile, doesn't seem people are happy to work here which is unfortunate and I believe affects a restaurant overall.  Beyond that I really can't stand when someone is sweeping the booth across from you while your trying to eat.  Realistically that is where the two stars is coming from, and it is not one because I like Fridays in general.  But it is not very sanitary to be sweeping up dust and junk while people are eating.  The restaurant is not super full just close off a section and sweep it and work your way around or sweep after it closes.  Not sure if this is allowed per public health standards but it should not be maybe use a wet mop or those pad sweeper things that are like wet naps.
Bar area blows. The waitresses are always busy with each other. Horrible customer service.

Slow slow slow service ! Took an hour to get one appetizer and a kids meal. Had to ask for everything including napkins which is just ridiculous . Never had such poor service here so I am super disappointed . No amount of I'm sorry or its on its way makes it better .
Some like it HOT!!!! Something bout' them wings!! Bottomless pit HOT! !!& SEXXXY...oh sorry the wings..I'm a leggs girl myself!!! These scorching HOT!! wings is the business...I'm going all the way!
This place is awesome! There's always a seat at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly and accommodating. Joe and Rachel are so cool!!! Thanks guys! Keep up the good work !!

Just your ordinary run of the mil establishment. Happy Hour all day on Sunday, their concept is every day is Friday. The gross beers are on happy hour, not the craft beers, they also have a couple of mixed drinks on happy hour. The mixed drinks were okay, had a long island iced tea. Also had an IPA, and you really can't go wrong with draft brews.  We ordered a couple of appetizers because they were half price, the jack daniels boneless wings are always good, but the quantity seemed to have diminished over the last couple years. We also ordered the nachos which were okay, I would have liked it if they had beans on it and more real cheese instead of that nacho cheese from a can. My daughter got the ribs kids meal and she cleaned those bones off like a puppy.  Fridays is a good place to get together for drinks and appetizers, the bar area at this location was very big. Our server was also pretty cool, he filled our glasses when they needed to be and made sure we were happy.

Dining Room service is horrible, I live real close and have been here three times. All three times the host was rude and our servers were rude. They seem like they don't like working there and like we are bothering them by coming in. Never coming back to eat. Bar service is excellent. We come here to drink at the bar once a week and have never received bad service. Will continue to come to the bar.

I give it 2 stars only because my waiter was awesome. But like everyone else the wait of 30mins for chicken wings....bad. I decided to update my review and give this place 4 stars because I did what so many reviewers don't do, I simply asked why was it taking so long.  Afterr discovering that a party of 20 showed up, the kitchen got extremely overwhelmed....completely understood.  Then I sat and watched and was amazed at how all of the wait staff was rushing around and they were ALL helping each other out.  THAT is something I have neve seen.  I then spoke to the manager and told her how impressed I was to see how her staff pulled together and really worked as a team.  My waiter, Matt, even went up to a couple upon their arrival, and explained that he wasn't their server, as she was very busy, but that he wanted to make sure to get them a drink while they waited....AWESOME customer service.  This restaurant could be a training ground for the restaurant industry. Well, today we decided to stop in for a mini celebration and I literally will never go here again. Coming from someone who was in the industry for 9 years, I'm not just a picky customer. Well, they ended up being 10 bucks each.  We were going to get food, but honestly nothing really looked great. Honestly I won't ever  be back again. We went over to Cabo Cantina instead.

On Friday, May 20th, 2016,  my family and church family went out to dinner to celebrate my nephews college graduation. We went to TGI Friday's in the city of Brea California. We were a large group of African-American families which came together to celebrate his accomplishment at dinner. We arrived at the restaurant and was seated.  We were assigned a waitress name Holly to take our orders. Immediately me and some of my family members could say it's tension from the waitress. We are not sure why she had a bad attitude but we try to overlook it. We begin to order food and drinks, a large part of the party ordered endless appetizers along with a main course meal. Holly made a comment out of the blue that we could not share our appetizers with each other and then Holly disappeared for 25 over minutes. When she finally returned she brought drinks.  When we inquired about the food and how long it would take she commented "There's just so many of you, it's going to take a while".  My brother-in-law then asked is it possible for us to get a basket of bread for the table since it's going to take a while for the food to come she replied "We don't give out free bread!" So she denied giving bread to 1 out of 25 people because he was very hungry while he was waiting for his food and he needed to take his medication. It took about 35 to 45 minutes for the appetizers to arrive let alone the main courses that we ordered which took even longer. Holly did not pick up one dirty plate from our table so there were dirty plates sitting there the entire time from the time it made it to the plate until after we left. When you have endless appetizers they continue to bring plates we had five plates stacked on top of each other just in one area the table was left filthy! Holly continue to make comments out of the blue that had nothing to do with anything that anyone asked. She was voluntarily making discriminatory comments. Because we had such a large party and the families were separate we are asked for separate checks from the beginning. As each family attempted to pay their check for their family, Holly started collecting identifications from us. I have never been requested to give my identification to a waitress unless I was ordering alcoholic beverage which was not the case because we are all attending church and we do not drink. When she asked for my ID, I refused to show my ID for a TGI Friday bill that was not going to be any more than $40 or $50. I told her that she was being races and discriminating against my party the entire night, I asked her why was she only carding my particular party. I asked her how many other tables did she card that night she had no reply. She stated that she was carding the entire table and I said I know you are because we are black, so you were insinuating that this large party of black people with several different checks for their individual families are paying with fake credit cards for themselves and their children at Friday's for a inexpensive $50 dinner? Really? She stated that it was the policy of all Friday's restaurants. I informed her that I have eaten at Friday's in over 30 occasions and this is never happened to me. I asked for a manager and she never returned with the manager. At this time I was completely fed up with being racially discriminated against and I left the restaurant after paying my bill. We also had to explain to my 11-year-old son what discrimination was and why we were being discriminated against. That night after I arrived home, I could not sleep. I laid in bed tossed and turned and thought about the incident all night. I was having stomach pain's and I had to use the restroom in the middle of the night.

Service started out slow and I was worried, having read other reviews. My waitress, I forgot her name, was very apologetic. She said the manager was helping catch the kitchen up. I thought about leaving because I was in a hurry, but then she came out with my food quicker than expected and was very polite and professional. While I wish the service had been quicker from the start, it did seem like the people working that night were working hard to get people's food out quickly.

So I have been here a couple of times. This place is nice. Inside they have tvs around the bar. That's where I like to conjugate. But sometimes the day is nice or I have ridden my bike from home to here and just stopped for a quick beer or margarita. Then I choose to be outside. I have quickly found out that they allow dogs out there. That's cool. This way if you are walking your dog you can make this place a stopping point and get a drink. Or if you are a person that can't leave your pooch at home when you go out to eat, well here is another spot you can bring him/her too.  The food is good to ok. Depends on what you order. From simple sliders on happy hour to steam and lobster during the the week at happy hour also. But before 6 pm. Haven't had that yet. But the ribs are great on Wednesday.  There is so much to choose from. You have four all carbs meals to all protein meals. If you are a veggie lover they cater to you as well. I've been here during an Angels game and everyone is cheering. Until they lost. Also I caught one NBA playoff game. They will put it on for you if you ask and if they can get it. Sorry no Dodgers game here either. But you can't get it all.  Drinks , well they can make whatever your little or big heart desires. Fruity drinks foo foo drinks for you know who. Yes most of you girls. Margarita are good. Beers are nice and cold. They don't have many IPAs or dark beers. They do have lots of others in bottles. They do have a nice happy hour special. They even have Pabst Blue Ribbon.   So they have some choices on dessert but I can't recommend one due to that either I'm full of food or beer/drinks. I will assume they are good.   And on Sunday it's Happy Hour All Day. No sad hour on Sunday. Now that the days are getting longer and warmer. Sit outside and enjoy the evening.
Our server Matt was awesome! So nice, customer service level was exceeded. Great food and service. Definitely will be back. :-)

Went to this place last night (Friday night) Hung out at the bar area. Bar tenders don't check up on you, no napkins, no silverware, food takes forever. Had to eat my wings on a cocktail napkins because we got no plates. I mean wtf man... Shouldve gone to BJ's instead. SERVICE IS A DISASTER. Not sure if everyone was on break but everyone including bartenders were just hanging out talking about their plans for the weekend. How you expect to get a tip if you treat your customers like they are invisible?
I put 1 star because i have to. We waited 1hr and 45 min waiter was shit manager should be fired for her lack of accommodating the resturants guest. DONT EVER GO HERE!!!
This Friday's was just average! I got the Jack Daniels Chicken which was a little over cooked in my opinion. The service was so so, the waitress barley came around when the place was simi empty.
There were more tables open than occupied and when told there is a 10 minute wait, I decided to go elsewhere. That just wreaks of inefficiencies and poor service.

I just want to start by saying that we don't usually go to TGI Fridays so I was really looking forward to trying a different spot for lunch. I'm usually a Cobb salad girl but I decided to try something different since I noticed a new item on the menu. The chicken club sandwich caught my eye so I had that with the sweet potato fries. I don't come to tgif that much but I was in the neighborhood and decided to go. I went at 9pm and thought that it was closed since it was really dead and there were very few servers. I usually never review, but want warn others to stay away! We ordered appetizers and 20 minutes later I finally asked...where are our appetizers. Slowest service ever. 2 hours and it wasn't even busy. Plus there was a hair in my sons grilled cheese. As I have been to many of the restaurants, this one seems to be very consistent with others. We sat in the bar area and the service was great. I had the Jack Daniel's ribs and shrimp. It was good food for the price. Drinks were made well which always makes things better.
Jack Daniel ribs are awesome.  A little pricey, but if you sign up with the rewards program,  it's a good deal. The wait time is awhile for food to arrive.

Had a great experience here friday night. Expected a big crowd and long wait. Our server keyona was very nice! Seems like the kitchen was running behind for some reason and the manager gave us free house salads to hold us over. I felt silly cause about 5 minutes later our food came! But I appreciated the gesture

I have to eat out about 4 days a week due to business travel . Try to eat nearby like this time. This was the worst service I've had in years including McDonald's. .. There are other places to eat and I will not be back anytime soon.

I dont regret going to TGIF. The customer service was awesome and their food was delicious, it was better than i expected. Would go there often.

Worst customer service EVER!!! Watching a baseball game and they turn it over for a couple who want college football. Ask for manager and zero to be found in 30 minutes. Only one direction this place is going. SIMPLY DON'T GO!!!

I don't believe places deserve anything less than 4 stars-- because it does impact their business. But I do believe they deserve honesty. With that said, they need to work on staffing and communication. Very disappointed in this location. I love T.G.I. Since this is a reoccurring problem.
Service is usually slow here. Takes awhile to get a drink. Food is usually good though.

i dont go out to eat very often, but when i do, i expect to get my money's worth. i hadnt been to this location in about a year.  i was dying for a good steak, the ribeye pictures kept calling to me.  so i ordered the $23 ribeye dinner.  my friend ordered a new yourk steak, we shared our sides. the baked potato was only half cooked, it was too hard to smash so i only ate some of it.  but the big disappointment was the steak. i was telling my friend how ribeyes are the most tender, tastiest of steaks.  mine was cooked exactly as i asked, medium, but i couldnt cut it with the serrated knife!  i tried several places, it was like hard rubber!  when i finally did cut off a few small pieces, i could hardly chew them.  it felt like it had been microwaved.  perhaps cooked earlier, then microwaved to warm it up? even the color was off. the cut sides showed a weird brownish yellow color next to the pink center.   after 2 or 3 bites and almost gagging to swallow it, i called the waiter over (nice young man) and he immediately got the manager. she was very apologetic and said she would have a fresh one cooked for me.  i ate the sides while waiting for my new steak.  the new one was soft and juicy and tasty like it should have been in the first place.  i was still annoyed that i had to go through that, wait for a new one, because i didnt enjoy it as much as i would have if they had it right in the first place. after eating all the side dishes my appetite was suppressed and it wasnt as enjoyable an experience as it should have been.  i'm shocked that they would serve a rubbery old steak to begin with. and if i hadnt been assertive, i would have gagged down part of a steak that i didnt like, and been out about $30 for my meal (after tax and tip). next time i want a good ribeye, i'll go to chili's or outback, or just bbq one at home!
First time here, came for granddaughters birthday food was pretty good,  service was excellent thanks to Holly,  she did a wonderful job,  for Hollywood. Recommend to visit this establishment.
Love this place!!   Always have great service and great attitudes from everyone that works here.  Bartender Margie took care of us as always.  Love her attitude and great personality.

Came here with my family for an early dinner. There was a 20 minutes wait even though the restaurant were not busy and there were open tables.  Once seated, we were greeted by our server right away. She was friendly and funny - loved her! She took our drink + food order in a timely manner. Our kids meals came within 10 minutes, however our soup came about 20 minutes after we ordered, while our food took more 30 minutes, maybe even longer than that.
