They were already done with their meals but was just hanging around chatting. 2 hostesses literally walked right next to the table and called the manager over, then told him there were a group of 10 waiting for that table. The manager then walked up to the group, and asked them if they were going to leave soon because they needed the table. I personally thought that was kind of rude. That group left within 5 minutes.  While I was finishing up my food, the same two hostesses stood right by MY table, then kept looking at us, and whispering. I guess maybe someone was waiting for our table too and they decided it was OUR time to go. We spent maybe ONE FULL hour there mainly because our food came so late. My husband needed to use the restroom while my kids and I stayed at the table to wait for him. The whole time the hostesses kept walking by our table and kept glaring at us to "check" if we were going to leave soon. It made me felt very uncomfortable. As soon as we got up...just literally got up from our chairs, the hostesses came rushing back by our area and the busboys took our highchair away and started clearing our table.  I don't think I'll come back again. My server was great, food was good, restaurant was very clean... but I honestly don't like being rushed to leave, especially when I had just barely finished eating my food. I only had ONE glass of iced tea so it wasn't as if I was sitting there drinking refills after refills. It just feels very uncomfortable having the hostess gawk over your table. Yikes!
Tried calling to ask a question but their number that's posted both on google & on here is out of service!! Pissing me off already & I haven't even come in yet.

Sucks that I noticed this after I ate the first half. DISGUSTING. RAW CHICKEN. the manager wasn't even apologetic at all. Just took off my meal only from the check and basically just wanted us out of there.  UPDATE: called corporate to talk to them about the raw chicken and they didn't answer. I left a message and they never returned my call. TGI fridays will never get my business again.

I only come here because its open late. The service here can be lackluster, but hey, it's not like this place is a Michelin Stared establishment--I'd be surprised if I actually got excellent service. The food here is modest, mostly what you expect for a chain casual dine-in restaurant. To be on the safe side the best thing you can order is either their beer or liquor--hard to mess that up. The next best thing you could probably order is their appetizers. Beer and some fairly decent appetizers, meh not too bad.

TGIFriday's always rocks. No matter where you go, you get the same great service, really great food in generous portions, they are open LATE and the serve great drinks. The menu is expansive. Even the pickiest eater will find something to love.  Every time I leave, I am so happy I came.   2 thumbs up.   Keep up the great work.
No one is in charge here and employees can't handle it.  I have been waiting over 40 min for sliders and a fajita.  This is ridiculous.  We are about to walk out.

Manager is a biatch. Expect typical franchise service. I ordered drink just minutes before happy hour and the bartender takes his sweet time to prepare and charge them on the bill after happy hour. When I asked to adjust the bill, the manager just dumps a revised receipt and no apology or even any word. I guess it's typical for a franchise to provide such level of  customer service.  After all, it's TGIF. They rarely have repeat businessm

Went for happy hour...wasnt happy at all. We ordered our last round of drinks before happy hour ended at 6:52. Server took about 15 mins to get our drinks. He charges us regular price. So rude...i dont know how she didnt get fired from all the complains.

If I could rate zero star, I would! There were seven people in my party today, two of us ordered rib eye steak including myself. A female manager came to apologize for their kitchen's mistake but offered only to take out the cost of only one order! That's so wrong to me! They really need to take out both orders from our bill!

This is my favorite TGIF's... except for today. I haven't been here in almost 4 months but I have been coming to this one for over 10 years. I sat there for almost 15 minutes and she never even said hello. She needs to go to training mode and work on her people skills. I got up and left, I came to Chili's and the service was excellent even though they were busier that Friday's.
Been waiting for unlimited wings for 35 minutes now . What a waste of money and time . It's not hard

My first time at this location was bad but I thought I would try again. I shouldn't have. This place is ridiculous. Take your money to a restaurant that cares about the customer and doesn't charge for a drink refill of lemonade.

Don't know why there are many negative reviews, we come here often, and it's always great,service, and warm food, and yes there are a few times the food takes a bit longer than usual, but that's if it's a fri,sat or Sunday , those are the busiest days of the week why wouldn't it take longer, if the place is packed!!anyways my review is for my visit this Sunday 3-5-17,our server Tya was awesome, great service and with a smile, she was on top of it, food was on point and she made sure our endless apps kept coming  She has a great attitude, and even had my kids laughing!!great job, TGIF,

It's TGI, you love it or hate it.  I LOVE IT!!! Renee, Rachel, Keith, an all the bartenders make this place worth going to, mostly cause they make u feel like a friend not a customer! For industry people this is the spot cause they are still open when we all get off late.
My folks and I have eaten lunches here a couple times so far. It's slightly better than City of Industry's location. It can get loud and noisy even when not crowded.
Went there around 3:30pm on the weekday to avoid the crowd, ordered the food right away, and still ended up with at least 1-hour wait for the lousy food.  We won't come back!!!

The food was good and the staff was extremely friendly but my family and I were concerned about the time it took to get our orders. Other than that, I had an overall enjoyable experience at this location.

By far THE WORST restaurant experience I have ever had in my entire life! Beside the food being practically inedible, the service was horrible. My church family and I went to celebrate one of Pastor's birthday. We were a party of 20 something people. I can't stand this place. The franchise itself has gone down in general. Their prices are a lot higher than it used to be, for smaller portions than what it used to be as well. Had a great time tonight.  TYA our server, best server I've ever had.  Great service, great attitude.  Coming back to this one, about to be a TYA regular.
If you want your waiters to forget to place your Order and make you wait 40 min plus 20 for ranch TGIF is the place for you.

Reese, our server, was awesome at the Brea location BUT NOT only did they run out of a new item: the meatballs appetizer but it seems like they PURPOSELY take long to bring out the next appetizers when you order the Endless Appetizers. I looooove!!! coming into this location. They have always treat us amazing and they have the best customer service! Believe me, I've been at many Fridays and the only one I keep coming is this one.  The food is great and the drinks are well served as well. Keep up the great job!

Horrible Service!! Constantly had to remind the server about our orders. They took forever to bring us our food and didn't even bother asking if we needed refills. We order a Oreo madness and they basically dumped cookie crumbs on top on ice cream. I couldn't even finish my food because I lost my appetite from being so annoyed with their service.

Very disappointed!  Years ago, I used to be a regular for drinks and appetizers at the bar. Took 10 minutes to be greeted by our server and give drink orders. After getting our drinks, it took even more time for the server to return. We had to have the bar tender track her down to take our orders.  After a lengthy wait for the food, my buffalo wings were small and some of the dozen had hardly any meat (overly priced at $12).  My half rack of ribs were small with decent flavor. After dealing with the long wait at 2pm in an empty restaurant and decent food at best, my TGIF'S days are gone. No wonder this Friday's has such a bad rating!   The service was so bad.  Took 20 minutes to get our drinks in the bar area.  I took the picture to show no one was there.  What a disgrace to Fridays to have such bad service. This manager need to get rid of the bad servers and get people that can properly serve the customers.   We ordered apps and they took forever.  We did not get the 3rd one.  I guess they thought we had enough.  We eventually had to ask but they did not have them made.  What a joke of a place.  The workers and management should be ashamed of how they service customers here.  They all need to be trained for sure because they clearly forget service.   Wish I could give a Zero.   They deserve at least that.   If you want service and food.    Go somewhere else!!!! This place is that bad!!!!

I tried their late night happy hour for the first time on a Saturday evening with a friend. We arrived at TGI close to 11 and opted to sit in the dining room area, since we would more likely receive better service than if we sat at the bar. We both ordered their $6.25 Long Islands (an awesome drink deal and my favorite cocktail). The drink was very well-made and quite possibly one of the best Long Islands I've ever had! Food-wise, we shared their cheap fries deal, fries... $1.50 during happy hour! The basket of fries served to us was huge and enough to share amongst 4 people give or take. They're weren't soggy, yet nicely seasoned with a seasoning that tasted like Lawry's Seasoned Salt. The fries were crispy but not to the point where they were even the slightest crunchy (crunchy fries in my opinion are not appetizing). We also ordered the burger sliders and pot stickers appetizers (prices for all apps are 50% off during happy hour). These two apps looked better than they tasted. The plating presentation was appeasing, however, the beef patties were dry and the pot stickers (definitely the frozen kind) did not taste good and were not piping hot when they were delivered.  I understand that it was towards the tail end of the later happy hour and the kitchen is starting to close up, but they shouldn't put any less effort into delivering exceptional food according to their restaurant standards. Yet, unfortunately these types of mediocre restaurants (TGI and similar chains: Chili's, Applebee's, Red Robin, etc.) are subpar most of the time. In overview, I will definitely be back for more of those addictive Long Islands, as well as trying out more of their appetizing and skipping over the ones I ordered this time around.
